title: The JSON-RPC trace_filter method can cause a Thread block
body:
### Description
Hi, while I was testing the JSON-RPC API I noticed that the _filter_ method of _TRACE_ API accepts a large block range which can cause a Thread block exception and possible leads to DoS the node.

I'm receiving the exception when sending a block range like 0 - 100000000

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Enable the JSON-RPC and TRACE API on the Node
2. Call the trace_filter method with a large block range
3. curl -X POST --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"trace_filter","params":[{"fromBlock":"1","toBlock":"1000000000","after":2,"count":2,"fromAddress":["0xfe3b557e8fb62b89f4916b721be55ceb828dbd73"]}],"id":415}' http://127.0.0.1:8548
4. Checking the logs, there will be a lot of Thread blocked exceptions, which will need to reboot the node to stop it from spawn

**Expected behavior:** An error message when the supplied block range is too large

**Actual behavior:** The node will fetch the traces between the entire block range causing a Thread exception, and keeping the client waiting until timeout the request

**Frequency:** Every time when a large block range is supplied.

#### Short Fix

A limit for the block range can be applied as occurred on the [eth_getLogs](https://besu.hyperledger.org/23.4.0/public-networks/reference/api#eth_getlogs)
